channel.title: Illegal to Receive donations/payments on your server
channel.description:
Apparently it is against the mojang TOS to receive payments/donations for items on your server. So it's RSPS all over again lol.
I'm just wondering if everyone else knew this already? I just assumed it was okay to do because every big server does it.
One of my friends wanted to run a big server and emailed them to see if he could sell VIP and other things on his server and they said no.

item.title: Illegal to Receive donations/payments on your server
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Bowser jr:

Donations for items, not donations in general. You’re simple not allowed to treat people different depending on how much they paid.

I thought every single donation was “general”, because that is what makes it a donation. If someone is specifically donating for an item, that would be called purchasing. People have been slinging the donation term around for way too long, and using it the wrong way.

Edit: I’m not quite sure how CraftBukkit is made, or any other general server source that is compatible with the Minecraft client, but I’m sure there are some exceptions in purchases.

Edit again: Could you please give me a direct link to where exactly you find this information (I know you said it was in the TOS), because every source I have read it is 100% legal to profit off of a Minecraft server, but if the profit is from a payment rather than a donation, you are required to pay taxes every year if you receive a certain amount of income; however, this is based on which country you live in, but if you live in the US, you have to pay taxes to the IRS once you receive a certain income amount.
